result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 121 days time served- to be applied only to prison sentence, if served.

miscConds.notes: Payment of costs + fees + DNA Surcharge- payment to be worked out with agent. Repayment of the $130 buy money.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored. Absolute sobriety. No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances, illegal in WI today without a valid Rx. No contact with known drug users or sellers, except in treatment, and only with prior agent approval. No entrance into any bars or taverns whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. May not take Suboxone or Methadone for any reason.

Full compliance with the terms of the DJA in Count 1. Full compliance with the terms of the Marinette County Drug Court Program. Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent. Any medications, including those prescribed, may only be taken with prior agent approval. Must take any medication prescribed for mental health or substance abuse. Mental health evaluation and follow through.

timeConds.notes: 1 year jail, imposed and stayed, to be used by the Treatment Court Judge for treatment or sanction purposes.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michaela Lee Vanidestine

records.addlTxt:
9:47 AM Defendant Michaela Lee Vanidestine in court, in custody.  Attorney Scott H Lyon in court for Michaela Lee Vanidestine.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Lyon provides plea form and DJA to the Court.
Court speaks to Deft regarding the Drug Court program.
Deft confirms she has read the handbook.
Deft understands the Drug Court program.
ADA heard on agreement.
Atty Lyon agrees.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 1.
Deft enters a plea of guilty.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 2.
Deft enters a plea of guilty.
Non-citizen advisory.
No firearms.
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Elements of offense.
Court reviews prior convictions.
Atty Lyon agrees.
Deft agrees.
Atty Lyon satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court accepts the DJA and finds it is in the public interest.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea but withholds the finding of guilt on Count 1, subject to the terms of the DJA.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds the Deft guilty to Count 2.
Court dismisses outright Count 3.
ADA heard on sentencing for Count 2.
Atty Lyon heard on sentencing.
Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.
Court imposed and stayed on Count 2:
3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision, and places Deft on probation for 3 years.
Credit for 121 days time served - to be applied only to prison sentence, if served.
Not eligible for CIP or SAP.
Conditions of probation:
1 year jail, imposed and stayed, to be used by the Treatment Court Judge for treatment or sanctions purposes.
Full compliance with the terms of the DJA in Count 1.
Full compliance with the terms of the Marinette County Drug Court Program.
Payment of costs + fees + DNA surcharge - payment to be worked out with agent.
Repayment of the $130 buy money.
Absolute sobriety.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today without a valid prescription.
No contact with known drug users or sellers, except in treatment, and only with prior agent approval.
Completion of all assessments, counseling, and follow through as recommended by agent.
No entrance into any bars or taverns whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Any medications, including those prescribed, may only be taken with prior agent approval.
Must take any medication prescribed for mental health or substance abuse.
May not take suboxone or methadone for any reason.
Mental health evaluation and follow through.
